Package chess.model.moves

package chess.model.moves
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    chess.model
     
    chess.model.exceptions
     
    chess.model.pieces
     
    chess.model.player
     
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    Capture
    A concrete object that represents a capture.
    Castling
    A subcategory of the regular move that represents a Castling, with a King being the subject piece of the main movement and a target Rook making a subsequent regular move.
    EnPassantCapture
    A concrete object that represents an en passant capture, a special type of capture applied only to Pawn's.
    Movable
    An abstract, generic, and overarching representation of a Chess movement, defined by: The initial position of the piece. The final position of the piece. The initiator (White or Black) of the movement. Upon initializing any subclass instances of the class, the instance keeps its own copy of Position objects in an effort to preserve a non-referential description of the movement.
    Movement
    An abstract and generic internal representation of a movement.
    PlayerMove
    A raw, "type-less" representation of moves made by any player that is to be interpreted, validated, and executed by ChessGame, serving as an input packet bearing only minimal information necessary to describe a movement initiated by some player.
    RegularMove
    A concrete subtype of Movement that represents a regular move.
    TwoSquareAdvance
    A subcategory of the regular move that represents a Pawn's initial two-square advance.
